snippet: Criminals are increasingly using expensive artworks — bought and sold in secret and with little regulation — to hide ill-gotten profits, the authorities say.
abstract: Authorities say that criminals are increasingly using expensive artworks, bought and sold in secret with little regulation, to launder money and hide ill-gotten profits; famously opaque art market has become a haven for smugglers, drug traffickers and others as more traditional money-laundering techniques come under greater scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: Criminals are increasingly using expensive artworks — bought and sold in secret and with little regulation — to hide ill-gotten profits, the authorities say.

headline.seo: Art Proves Attractive Refuge for Money Launderers
headline.main: Valuable as Art, but Priceless as a Tool to Launder Money
headline.print_headline: Valuable as Art, but Priceless As a Tool to Launder Money
